meanings.definition: To utter a long, loud, high-pitched call, typically to attract attention.
meanings.sent1: She was cooeeing for her lost dog in the park.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was cooeeing to signal his location to the rescue team.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started cooeeing along with the sirens, creating a strange symphony.
meanings.sent4: Her voice cooeeing through the forest, echoing like a ghostly melody.
meanings.sent5: The sound of cooeeing cut through the silence of the night, piercing and urgent.

meanings.definition: The act of calling out in a long, loud, high-pitched manner.
meanings.sent1: The cooeeing of the children playing outside filled the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: His cooeeing could be heard from miles away in the open fields.
meanings.sent3: The cooeeing of the auctioneer added an unexpected soundtrack to the event.
meanings.sent4: The cooeeing of the wind through the trees sounded like a chorus of voices.
meanings.sent5: The cooeeing of the seagulls by the beach was a familiar sound of summer.
